name: N-Butylbutan-1-amine
Reason: 1-amino-butane has a melting point of around -10°C due to the presence of a nitrogen atom, which increases the melting point due to hydrogen bonding potential. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure and raises the melting point by approximately +10°C. The butyl group introduces a more rigid structure and raises the melting point by approximately +20°C. The presence of two amino groups can increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding potential, approximately +20°C.
